steps.title: STG means “Swear to God” when used over text or on social media.
steps.content: STG means “Swear to God” when used over text or on social media. People sometimes use “stg” or “STG” as a way to add some frustrated emphasis or a sense of exaggeration to their social media posts. STG isn’t exclusive to a specific social media platform, though—it means “Swear to God” on TikTok, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, and most other sites/apps. [1] X Research source “He is trying my last nerve stg 🙄” “Stg it’s taken 3 years for this package to get here 😔🎁” Some people spell STG in all capital letters (STG), while other people spell it in with lowercase letters (stg). It means the same thing in both formats, though.

steps.title: Use STG to share your frustration.
steps.content: Use STG to share your frustration. Maybe you’re in a long line at the grocery store, or you’re waiting for a super long time at the doctor’s office. Sprinkle an STG into your social media posts and/or texts to let everyone know just how irritated you are. “STG the DMV line gets longer each time I come here 😞🚗” “If Jamie doesn’t show up I stg I’m gonna lose my mind 😡”

steps.title: Use STG to exaggerate whatever you have to say.
steps.content: Use STG to exaggerate whatever you have to say. It’s always fun to stretch the truth a little bit—and STG gives you the perfect opportunity to do so! Add a small exaggeration to your next post or text to take it to the next level. “I stg my parents have 40 bananas in their kitchen rn 🍌” “I stg my cousin is like 10 ft tall!! He could make serious money in the NBA lol 🏀”

steps.title: Reply to STG with a sympathetic message.
steps.content: Reply to STG with a sympathetic message. A lot of times, people are looking for support or validation when they include STG in a text or social media post. Feel free to reply with something comforting and supportive, so the other person feels a little less alone. Person 1: “I stg nobody cares how I feel 😭” Person 2: “I’m so sorry you’re having a tough time! I’m always here if you need to vent 💖” Person 1: “STG this job is gonna be the death of me. Customers are so rude 😠” Person 2: “That’s so frustrating! You deserve to be treated with respect 😤”

steps.title: Respond to STG by playing along with someone’s exaggeration.
steps.content: Respond to STG by playing along with someone’s exaggeration. People usually exaggerate for a reason—so you might as well just go along with it when you hear something far-fetched. You can always poke a little fun at them, too. Person 1: “I stg it takes a whole year for my BF to text me back 😒” Person 2: “That really stinks. Have you tried talking to him about it?” Person 1: “If I get called on to present first, I stg I’ll launch myself into the sun 😵” Person 2: “Isn’t the sun 93 million miles away from earth tho? 🤔”

steps.title: ISTG stands for “I Swear to God.”
steps.content: ISTG stands for “I Swear to God.” Some people prefer to leave a space between “I” and “STG,” while others stick all 4 letters together. [2] X Research source Regardless of the spacing, both variations mean “I Swear to God.” [3] X Research source “If anyone steals my parking space istg I’m gonna be so mad 😠” “ISTG no one ever listens to what I say 😔”

steps.title: Sterling (the British currency)
steps.content: Sterling (the British currency) Although “GBP” is the standard abbreviation for British currency, but some people choose to use “Stg” accompanied by a British pound sign ( Stg£). This abbreviation is especially common in the investment community. Example: The Class B Shares have a value of Stg£20,000,000. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Shoot Em Up or Shooting video games
steps.content: Shoot Em Up or Shooting video games The STG acronym is based on the word "shooting," rather than the phrase "Shoot Em Up." This game genre is pretty self-explanatory—you either play as a character armed with a weapon or as a giant weapon (like a spaceship), and your main goal is to shoot lots of enemies in your immediate vicinity with crazy amounts of ammo. [5] X Research source It can also stand for generic “shooting” video games, like a title from the Halo franchise. [6] X Research source Person 1: “What’s your favorite type of video game genre?” Person 2: “STG games definitely! Metal Slug will always have a special place in my heart 🔫🧡”

steps.title: SubTheGamer (YouTuber)
steps.content: SubTheGamer (YouTuber) If you’re a big basketball fan, you’ve probably watched some of STG’s content. If someone mentions an “STG video” or something similar, they’re probably referring to the YouTuber. [7] X Research source Example: “Yooo did you see the STG video that just dropped? 👀”

steps.title: Security Threat Group
steps.content: Security Threat Group In a prison setting, you might see the term STG thrown around. In this context, it refers a Security Threat Group, or a gang of dangerous prisoners. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Super Tan Girl
steps.content: Super Tan Girl In very specific situations, someone might text the word “STG” to refer to a woman who’s exceptionally tan. Example: “Yo I was on the beach and just passed this STG”
